title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: He went there on Saturday mornings and sat with the old men in heavy overcoats, turning the pages of  the  Glasgow Herald, the Weekly Scotsman, Punch  and the  Illustrated London News . The pillar box that received most attention was in a new housing scheme on the south side of  Edinburgh. The Corporation had decreed, apparently believing in the power of  historical romance to ennoble ordinary lives, that all the streets in the scheme be named after characters from Walter Scott's novels: Redgauntlet Terrace, Ravenswood Avenue, Balderston Gardens, and so forth. In November 1952, nine months after Elizabeth became Queen but seven months before her coronation in Westminster Abbey, a new Royal Mail pillar box bearing the legend 'EIIR' is installed on the corner of  Sir Walter Scott Avenue and Gilmerton Road.
